question.title: What does it mean when Eclipse displays a "Login required" dialog window on launch?
question.body:
May be related to my other question.
Eclipse IDE for Java Developers 2025-09 on Windows 10.
When launching the IDE, i.e. running file eclipse.exe (in the Eclipse installation folder), one of the messages in the status bar is Deferred Early Start â€“ as shown in below image.

After that message is displayed, the following dialog Window appears.
(Note that I have erased the actual name of the server in the URL. It is on the network of my place of work.)

I don't enter any details and click on the OK button.
Eclipse finishes launching and I don't have any [apparent] problems using the IDE.
I want to know what Eclipse is trying to log in to and whether not supplying login details has any consequences.
Note that I have been using Eclipse IDE for many years, always the most up-to-date version and the behavior described above only started occurring since version 2025-06 (4.36.0). Also, WindowBuilder is also installed.

EDIT

Replying to comment (from the busybee):
I added a local update site to the list of update sites in order to perform an offline installation of WindowBuilder.

EDIT 2

Replying to comment (from howlger):
List of update sites.

Startup and Shutdown
